definitions.definition: sit on and control the movement of (an animal, especially a horse), typically as a recreation or sport.
examples: Diana went to watch him ride his horse

definitions.definition: travel on a horse or other animal.
synonyms: gallop "they rode through the city streets in a triumphant motorcade"

definitions.definition: sit on and control (a bicycle or motorcycle) for recreation or as a means of transport.
examples: he rode a Harley Davidson across the U.S

definitions.definition: travel in or on (a vehicle) as a passenger.
examples: I started riding on the buses

definitions.definition: travel in (a vehicle) or on (a public transport system) as a passenger.
examples: she rides the bus across 42nd Street

definitions.definition: go through or over (an area) on horseback, a bicycle, etc.
examples: ride the full length of the Ridgeway

definitions.definition: compete in (a race) on horseback or on a bicycle or motorcycle.
(of a vehicle, animal, etc.) be of a particular character for riding on or in.
examples: the van rode as well as some cars of twice the price

definitions.definition: transport (someone) in a vehicle.
examples: the taxi driver who rode Kelly into the airport not long ago

definitions.definition: be carried or supported by (something with a great deal of momentum).
examples: a stream of young surfers fighting the elements to ride the waves

definitions.definition: project or overlap.
examples: when two lithospheric plates collide, one tends to ride over the other

definitions.definition: (of a vessel) sail or float.
examples: a large cedar barque rode at anchor

definitions.definition: be full of or dominated by.
examples: you must not think him ridden with angst

definitions.definition: yield to (a blow) so as to reduce its impact.
examples: Harrison drew back his jaw as if riding the blow

definitions.definition: have sexual intercourse with.
annoy, pester, or tease.
examples: if you don't give all the kids a chance to play, the parents ride you

definitions.definition: a journey made on horseback, on a bicycle or motorcycle, or in a vehicle.
synonyms: road trip; Morelift; informalspin "a ride in the new car"

definitions.definition: a person giving someone a lift in their vehicle.
examples: their ride into town had dropped them off near the bridge

definitions.definition: a motor vehicle.
examples: that green Chevy over there, that's my ride

definitions.definition: the quality of comfort or smoothness offered by a vehicle while it is being driven, as perceived by the driver or passenger.
examples: the ride is comfortable, though there is a slight roll when cornering

definitions.definition: a path, typically one through woods, for riding horses.
a demonstration of horse riding as an entertainment.
a roller coaster, merry-go-round, or other amusement ridden at a fair or amusement park.
an act of sexual intercourse.
a cymbal used for keeping up a continuous rhythm.
